channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Climate change is boosting the risk of sleep apnea
item.description: Hotter temperatures make breathing problems during sleep more likely, even when it's not extremely hot

item.title: 'It's such a dream': Top high school performers step out on Broadway
item.description: With a billboard in Times Square and a night on Broadway, the year's top high school performers are ready for their big moment at the Jimmy Awards.

item.title: The David Lynch estate auction doubled as a caffeinated wake

item.title: Iran’s Nuclear Dreams May Survive Even a Devastating American Blow
item.description: Through revolution and upheaval, the program has become intertwined with the country’s security and national identity.

item.title: Inside the U.S. Strikes on Iran, and a Dangerous Heat Wave Spreads
An AI video ad is making a splash. Is it the future of advertising?
item.description: The over-the-top ad combines the energy of Grand Theft Auto with the drama of the NBA Finals — all created by AI. Is it a sign of things to come?

item.title: Where Does Iran Go Now?
item.description: While foreign wars may expose autocratic fragility, they rarely create the conditions necessary for democratic change.

item.title: Russian Attack on Kyiv Kills at Least 7, Ukraine Says
item.description: The barrage was the latest in a series of deadly strikes by Moscow, which have intensified as cease-fire talks have largely stalled.

item.title: European officials voice fears of further escalation in the Israel-Iran war.

item.title: A.I. Computing Power Is Splitting the World Into Haves and Have-Nots
item.description: As countries race to power artificial intelligence, a yawning gap is opening around the world.
